messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Northern Opportunity
messages.msgSnippet: Where are you in Canada?  My dh is from Toronto and his  family is all still in that area.  We ve been (half jokingly) kicking around the idea of moving closer
messages.messageBody:
Where are you in Canada? My dh is from Toronto and his family is all
still in that area. We've been (half jokingly) kicking around the idea
of moving closer to them.
Angel

'Many would sooner die than think. In fact, they do.'
~Taerlhain Limeryn


-----Original Message-----
From: KathrynJB@... [mailto:KathrynJB@...]
Sent: Tuesday, September 07, 2004 8:03 AM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Northern Opportunity



In a message dated 9/6/2004 2:46:29 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

I was wondering if any of you unschoolers would mind moving
to Canada? It's a bit chilly in the winter, but we don't have
hurricanes (OR REPUBLICANS)!! C'mon - think about it! We make things
like bacon, and beer! We made Mike Meyers and Celine Dion! I have a
great husband and 3 beautiful boys. We have a non-shedding dog and a
pool. Let me know whatever else your hearts desire, and I'll see
what I can do to sweeten the pot (oh yeah, they grow that, too).




<http://us.adserver.yahoo.com/l?M=298184.5285298.6392945.3001176/D=group
s/S=:HM/A=2319498/rand=667061706>

messages.subject: Re: Northern Opportunity
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for Anne O s info everyone. And thanks to my friend in Nova Scotia for the offer of support -- unfortunately, I m in southern Ontario. Anyone else from
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for Anne O's info everyone. And thanks to my friend in Nova
Scotia for the offer of support -- unfortunately, I'm in southern
Ontario. Anyone else from this area?
Sandy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Northern Opportunity
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sandy, where do you live? Dartmouth (Nova Scotia) and area has a strong unschooling community. The Annapolis valley has a good group as well but most of
messages.messageBody:
At 01:37 PM 9/6/04, you wrote:
>I met so many wonderful people at the conference, and now I'm really
>lonely. I was wondering if any of you unschoolers would mind moving
>to Canada? It's a bit chilly in the winter, but we don't have
>hurricanes (OR REPUBLICANS)!! C'mon - think about it! We make things
>like bacon, and beer! <snip>

Sandy, where do you live? Dartmouth (Nova Scotia) and area has a strong
unschooling community. The Annapolis valley has a good group as well but
most of them are younger children. Lots of us are going camping this week
at Kejimikujik National park. It's like a mini unschooling conference in
the woods :-)

But, shh, we had a wicked hurricane here last September.

Donna (Andrea) Gillis in Nova Scotia

messages.subject: Northern Opportunity
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all- OK, so for anyone who was at the conference, I was the wide-eyed, neophyte woman from Canada who kept saying, But I m really scared... I am somewhat
messages.messageBody:
Hi all-
OK, so for anyone who was at the conference, I was the wide-eyed,
neophyte woman from Canada who kept saying, "But I'm really
scared..." I am somewhat less terrified these days (thanks to this
great site, etc) but my husband and youngest son go b-2-s tomorrow,
so the old panic is starting to rear its ugly schoolhead again. I
met so many wonderful people at the conference, and now I'm really
lonely. I was wondering if any of you unschoolers would mind moving
to Canada? It's a bit chilly in the winter, but we don't have
hurricanes (OR REPUBLICANS)!! C'mon - think about it! We make things
like bacon, and beer! We made Mike Meyers and Celine Dion! I have a
great husband and 3 beautiful boys. We have a non-shedding dog and a
pool. Let me know whatever else your hearts desire, and I'll see
what I can do to sweeten the pot (oh yeah, they grow that, too).
Hurry, though, cuz we are now down to one income so I don't know how
much longer we'll have the pool (the house may have to go, too).
Cheers,
Sandy
BTW, Does anyone have Anne Ohman's e-mail? She was going to give it
to me in Boston...
